docs.lead_paragraph: A wave of mergers between Roman Catholic and secular hospitals is threatening to deprive women access to important reproductive services.
docs.abstract: Editorial urges state regulators to closely examine mergers between Roman Catholic and secular hospitals and use whatever powers they have to block those that diminish women's access to abortions, contraception and sterilization.
docs.snippet: A wave of mergers between Roman Catholic and secular hospitals is threatening to deprive women access to important reproductive services.

docs.lead_paragraph: The revised bill requires women to have an ultrasound before getting an abortion, but says that they cannot be forced to have a vaginal ultrasound.

headline.seo: Virginia Ultrasound Bill Passes as Other States Take Notice
headline.main: Virginia Senate Passes Ultrasound Bill as Other States Take Notice
headline.print_headline: Other States Take Notice Of Measure On Abortion

docs.abstract: Virginia Senate, changing course after an unwelcome national uproar, adopts revised bill that still requires women to have an ultrasound before getting an abortion, but also says that they cannot be forced to have a vaginal ultrasound; furor has already had an effect in other states considering ultrasound mandates.
docs.snippet: The revised bill requires women to have an ultrasound before getting an abortion, but says that they cannot be forced to have a vaginal ultrasound.

byline.original: By ERIK ECKHOLM and KIM SEVERSON
